caption: Great neighborhood place, really great prices. Pasta is delicious, but also their Italian Beef! It's so good. Don't forget to try cold pressed drinks. Yummy.

We were randomly looking for a place to eat and stumbled upon this gem. Our food was delightful, our waitress was very attentive and lovely with our kids. Drinks vary from wines to healthy smoothies. We definitely found a place worth recommending and coming back for a cozy meal!

Ordered two dishes and the bruschetta for Valentine’s Day dinner. The portion sizes were nice and big and both dishes were incredibly delicious. They kept everything warm in the pan for me until I arrived to pick it up to ensure it was fresh which I thought put a nice touch on their great service. To top everything off they gave us a dessert on the house for the holiday! We will definitely be ordering from here again in the near future given the quality of the food and the service!!
All the dishes I ordered were delicious, they were also very gracious hosts. Recommend!
Great Pasta and they add extra Parmesan cheese. Molto bene.
We love this spot. The pasta is amazing. Highly recommend.
italian food, super yummy. atmosphere is like a restaurant in fort worth i loved.
We really enjoyed our pastas here, they were delicious! They give very nice sized portions which is always appreciated. The staff is incredibly friendly. We will definitely be coming back soon!
Great pasta and portions are fantastic

Great food! I placed an order for pickup and their set up was really great for social distancing. I got the spinach gnocchi alfredo - the pasta was so fresh! The panna cotta was luscious, truly melt in the mouth. The owners were so lovely, as well. Can't wait to order again!
Delicious pasta and very friendly staff. Highly recommend.
Very authentic, reminds me of my study abroad in Rome. Really nice people, fair prices, and the pasta is always fresh! 10/10 recommend

Just moved to the neighborhood and tried this place for the first time last weekend for an anniversary dinner. It was amazing! I was skeptical about pasta takeout but it turned out to be for no reason. I got the pasta bolognese and my girlfriend got the ravioli. Delicious and generous portions. The deserts were great as well, we got the tiramisu and cherry panna cotta.  Will definitely be getting it again! Can’t wait until things open back up and we can dine in.
This is a great place. It's in the space of a former casual sandwich shop so don't let the diner decor keep you from enjoying this place. This is really a great little gem of a place
Ordered from Uber last night. Best Pasta we had in a while! We loved it, the flavor was authentic and tasty! Perfect comfort food after a long, busy day!
Delicious food and phenomenally friendly owners who make the experience delightful

The pasta dishes are delishes. I got the puttanesca and my friend had the carbanara. Besides the hefty portions,  the flavor was amazing. The brushetta and house were not that great but the pasta dishes were their strong point.
Checked this place out this weekend and was super content with the service and food. Large selection as far as menu goes. Felt like a hidden gem! I will definitely be back.
Everything my wife and I got, was amazing! The portions were perfect, the flavors were spot on, and the people who work there are fantastic!
So so so good! Such nice people! Check em out. They are wonderful :)
This is the best Italian food I've had in Chicago.

Honestly the best Italian food I've ever had. My partner and I have picked up dinner take out twice during quarantine and it's been so amazing--I used to not like pasta!! The folks here are so friendly and we're looking forward to coming back to dine in.

Best food I have had in a long time. Very reasonable price. Very kind owners. They take time to make you the best. Very very impressed. Wish more people came. It is up to us to support small businesses!
Great food, AWESOME service. Brightened up our quarantine when we grabbed some takeout with friendly faces and smiles.

I almost never do reviews of places but felt compelled. I'd never heard of Pasta Passion but my partner and I were craving Italian tonight and it was the only place near us that was doing takeout.  First, the staff was so incredibly kind.  Second, the tomato sauce onoon the pasta was excellent and the rosemary butter sauce on the ravioli was phenomenal. Can't wait to try the rest of the menu.

I ate at this restaurant about 2 months ago and it was one of the best experiences I have had. I love italian food and everything I had here was delicious and high quality. Please support this wonderful buisness during this hard time. The owner and his step daughter were so nice and the food was authentic as well as delicious! Very unique and amazing experience here. I felt at home and welcomed here.
Fantastic food. We will go back again.

Really good pasta. We ordered pick up and the food was warm and flavorful. We had the pesto pasta as well as the puttanesca. I wanted to eat it all but the portion was quite big and I didn’t want to embarrass myself.
Amazing place with an amazing staff that really goes out of their way to make you feel at home.  I had the Truffle Gnocchi and it was delicious but the menu is large so I absolutely will be back.
Authentic verona, Italy taste. Their gnochi 's are the best,. So light and airy, yum.In house made pastas and desserts.server was the best.:)
This place is pretty cool. The owners are really friendly, the food is made from scratch from the pasta to the sauce and the desserts to the juices. Come give them a visit. Very cozy and homey vibe.
Excellent service excellent pasta
Great service, very attentive and the food is tasty for an excellent price. I recommend the Pasta Vodka and Panna Cotta Amaretto. I'm definitely visiting again soon.

We went here for our monthly girls' night dinner. The food was delicious. They make their pasta in house. I had squash stuffed ravioli with sausage and a butter sauce. The staff was super friendly and attentive. We were even treated to dessert. They are also BYOB.
Authentic Italian, generous portions!
Loved their desserts and you have to try the pasta! I've returned now multiple times and every dinner had been spectacular!
Good Service, excellent selection.  Food came out quickly and was very good.  Daughter had cheese ravioli, I had Vodka Penne Pasta.  You can tell owners care about all the details.

The staff was very kind and attentive and the pasta was good. Nice to see an Italian place that isn't the typical pizza/red wine/etc. The space they have is quite roomy and comfortable with a nice view of the street.
Quiet place with great service - our server was incredibly friendly and the food was excellent

Very friendly owners. They stay true to their name and pour their passion into this restaurant, and it reflects in the quality of the food and service. I also personally like the decor of their restaurant; it feels more traditional and authentic rather than flashy and hyper-modern. I think they're super underrated and deserve a lot more business.

Don't judge this book by it's cover. I've passed by this place over a dozen times thinking it was just some fast food noodle place, but despite the minimalist space, the variety and freshness of the home made noodles made for an amazingly authentic and affordable dining experience. I'll be returning for sure.

It was my second time eating here and the passion for their pasta has remained strong. 5/5 both times, you heard it here first. We ordered butternut squash ravioli with tomato and Italian sausage sauce and the carbonara. Pasta was perfectly al dente. For dessert we had tiramisu which could serve at least 3 people...great leftovers for your coffee in the morning. Plus we had some passionfruit pannacotta on the house. The owners were welcoming as always.  P.s. we just got back from Italy so we know what passion for pasta is.
Great spot in Lincoln Square. Service was personal and excellent, and you could tell they really care about their food. Convenient location close to the brown line.

This place is low-key and authentic. It's run by a Romanian couple who make all of the pasta from scratch. I feel like they don't get very much foot traffic because their aesthetic isn't very modern. It kind of looks divey but DUDE, SERIOUSLY... it's someone's passion project and you can tell. This is one of those places where the owners took a risk and poured all of their savings into the business in the hope that their food would speak for itself and let me just say... it does.  Within 3 visits the owners recognized me. They're very kind people who want to nurture their customers with their skill. If you're thinking about going to a place like Pasta Bowl, think twice and consider giving these folks your business. The food's way better and they deserve your business!

Above and beyond service. I did not realize they were not open yet when I came to this place. Despite coming when they were still closed, the owners were so welcoming. They took our orders and made the food just for us . They could have easily refused . We had some delicious focaccia and homemade pasta . Will definitely be back to try other things .
Great service, good pasta
(Translated by Google) Very good food, good prices and attention is very, very good  (Original) Muy rica la comida ,buenos precios y la atencion es muy pero muy buena

I was pleasantly surprised by this place! I had walked by several times and not thought much of it. I took myself out on a quiet dinner after a very bad day at work and just wanted some carbs. I went in with low expectations and was totally blown away. It's very much a casual place and was exactly what I was looking for.  I had the pasta speck and it was great! The noodles are all handmade and cooked perfectly. It even heated up well the next day. The portion was pretty large and could definitely feed two people if you had an appetizer or salad beforehand. I also tried their strawberry lemonade (made with sparkling water) and it was pretty good.  The night I was there, they were also giving out free dessert samples. I got a sample of the panna cotta with mixed berries. It was DELICIOUS! When I come back, I would definitely order it for desert.

Best Italian food I've had since living in Gaeta. Relaxed atmosphere and warm service. Extraordinary dishes I've tried so far:   Bruschetta Diavola, Pasta Puttanesca, Scalloppine Beef with Prosciutto Speck, Panna Cotta, and espresso. Everything is handcrafted and fresh.
Everything I’ve tried has been fantastic. Open kitchen so you can see chef Diego(from Italy) make your pasta from scratch in real time.
So good

Pasta Passion is a gem! We are lucky to have this Italian family owned business in Lincoln Square for authentic tastes of Italy. Simona and Diego are incredible chefs and make me nostalgic for the meals that brings me back to my time in Italy! I always feel welcomed when I come in for a sit down and take extra time to chat with them for take out. Simona makes the most incredible Asparagus Cream Soup, which are part of their rotating daily soup menu and Diego’s all homemade pastas are the perfect texture every time! If you haven’t had their Osso Busco, which is a dish I crave for and have a hard time finding elsewhere in the city, I highly recommend it. Definitely stop in with  for authentic Italian meals!!!
Very good food.
Great food and service. Small group of friends go here for good food and conversation.

One of my favorite places in Chicago. Family-run, super warm and welcoming service. Certain noodles are made from scratch in their kitchen, so good. Deserts are amazing. BYOB so bring a bottle of wine. I've been dozens of times. Ya gotta go.
(Translated by Google) Authentic Italian restaurant! I really like! 🇮🇹  (Original) Authentic Italian restaurant! Mi piace molto! 🇮🇹

I’ve walked by this place a million times and finally decided to head in with my son.  The pasta was homemade and delicious, as was the tiramisu! Good size portions and a really nice waitress and cook.  Check it out next time you’re in Lincoln Square.

This place was awesome! Fresh, delicious pasta, great service. They really cared and made sure we had a good meal and good experience. I will absolutely be back. Don't be fooled by the decor or lack of people inside. Everyone else is missing out. This place is real deal. They truly have a passion for pasta and good, authentic Italian cooking. Will absolutely be going back. Also the tiramisu was fantastic.
Great little spot hidden in the Square. Friendly ownership. Delicious pasta. Chef was kind. Will be back. Do recommend.
Fresh homemade pasta, tasted so good.  Definitely will be back.

Such a great family restaurant! I went with my 2 pasta loving kids and they were so happy with their meals. The waitress was so friendly and told us that any of the pasta dishes could be done in child size portions( and reduced the price). The Italian sodas were very tasty. I think it is worth every penny because all playa pastas are made on site as are the sauces. Check it out!

Don’t the let the name and the decor deter you. This place is truly passionate about their pasta - and it shows. We ordered the Pasta Vodka Sauce and Pasta Home Speck, both with their signature pasta shape. The pasta itself is perfectly al dente with a very smooth finish and chewy spring. There’s nothing fancy or fussy about the dishes. It’s homey and serves the purpose of tasty, filling food.
Don’t get turned away from the looks of it. The food is authentic and delicious. Everything is made in house. Bring extra wine. You’ll need it!
Excellent food, generous portions, reasonably priced.  Highly recommend.

This place looks a little unassuming from the outside, and a little unassuming from the inside as well, BUT, the food is AMAZING!!!!! Not only that, but it was so quiet that the chef said that he was happy to make any concoction that my husband and I could think of. Please try Pasta Passion and help it succeed as a restaurant. They deserve success based on the food alone, but also seem like genuinely nice people.
I had the gelato and was sweet but good. The pina colada shake was good too. I thought the Chicken Alfredo was good too, as long as you added red chili flakes.
Very authentic and family friendly
Lovely place! Great pasta!! A small and authentic part of Italy in Chicago!! Must visit! Expresso like we had in Italy!!
You should eat here. They have some of the best meatballs I’ve had in Chicago. Also their vodka sauce is phenomenal. Really friendly and attentive service as well. We’ll be back!
The staff is very attentive and the food is amazing! I’ve loved everything I’ve ever gotten here.
Truly impressed by the food and service. Pasta Passion is much, much more than the sum of its parts. Stick around for dessert and don’t miss the zuppa inglese!
Wide selection of pasta dishes, good service, and the pasta is great!  also a good selection of beverages (lemonades, teas, espresso, smoothies).  Will go back!

The food was amazing! This place is a diamond in the rough located in Lincoln Square. With some many Italian eateries, this one shines (plus Diego the chef is from Verona, Italy). I had enough leftovers for lunch the next day! Oh, and don't skip on having a grape lemonade - it blew my mind. I've never had anything like that ever. (FYI, it's also a BYOB)
Exceptional food and even better service! Price is great, generous portions, and plenty of homemade pastas to choose from. Please give this local place a try.

Amazing place, fresh pasta made in the house as well as all the other ingredients, delicious fresh squeezed juice and deserts to die for!!! Great prices, friendly people, cozy atmosphere and top service! Highly recommend! Big hug to all the people who took care of us and served our delicious Italian dishes!

The food is amazing. The atmosphere was great. I could not expect more. Based on what I have heard they just started this restaurant 3 months ago - based on the negative reviews maybe they had a rocky start. The pasta was fresh and they also served some Romanian and Greek dishes as well. The Tiramisu was perfect! When I got there the place was packed (based on the pictures) and I see this restaurant has potential. I will come back again and bringing my friends a long as well. I am sure they will love the food.

We grabbed dinner at Pasta Passion last night and love it! The pasta is made in house by Diego, the lovely Italian man who runs the place. Our meals were all delicious and the portions were huge! And it's BYOB! I can't wait return for another plate full of tasty pasta and for the friendly service.

This place is casual and has an outward appearance that does not suggest the amazing quality of food inside. Not only is the pasta made fresh here; it’s made fresh every day. The food is very authentic. The quality of ingredients are superb. The preparation is perfect.
Awful place, awful service, awful food prep.

I've been meaning to check this place out since it opened.  The food was great! Good portions of homemade pasta at a reasonable price. We had the pomodoro and the pesto. Their homemade lemonade was great too! We loved the focaccia bread!  The staff was very friendly,  they even treated us to dessert on a whim!  Please come check out this local business and give it your support!

This place is excellent. Prices definitely match the huge portions. Good ingredients, fast delivery, and incredible Tiramisu. They are a welcomed addition to the neighborhood. Try the speck pasta with garlic and mushrooms. Pass on the panna cotta.
Delicious family pasta style

BEST tiramisu cake in Chicago! The owner was hilarious and gave me his word that if I don’t love it, I can come back and eat for free. I will definitely go back but happy to pay and taste the rest of their delicious food!
Delicious food, super portion and excellent service. try tiramisu, oh, sooo rich
Not a fancy place, but the food was really good and service attentive. BYOB makes this a real bargain, too. Not many customers on a Sunday evening ... I hope more people give this place a try!
Wow!!!! amazing fresh handmade pasta! The tiramisu was the best I’ve ever had and the staff was so kind. Definitely go in and give it a try!

Great handmade authentic Italian pasta with generous portions. This is a  small family owned joint that is a welcome addition to the neighborhood. We order several dishes and liked all of them. I also enjoyed the freshly made juice.
Yeah really tasty food, glad we went in.

Pasta from scratch, fresh, made on premise. The texture will not disappoint! Large portions, be prepared to share or take some home. Very casual. BYOB from Gene's down the street. First time makes me think I could be a regular.
Great food! Happy to have them in the area!
